Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Tales \Ta"les\, n. [L., pl. of talis such (persons).] (Law) (a) pl. Persons added to a jury, commonly from those in or about the courthouse, to make up any deficiency in the number of jurors regularly summoned, being like, or such as, the latter. --Blount. Blackstone. (b) syntactically sing. The writ by which such persons are summoned. [1913 Webster]
{Tales book}, a book containing the names of such as are admitted of the tales. --Blount. --Craig.
{Tales de circumstantibus} [L.], such, or the like, from those standing about. [1913 Webster]
